name: IOUserNetworkEthernet
desc: The object you use to manage the setup, configuration, and teardown of your networking driver.

items.name: - init
items.desc: Handles the basic initialization of the service.

items.name: - free
items.desc: Performs any final cleanup for the service.

items.name: - RegisterEthernetInterface
items.desc: Registers your driver with the networking stack.

items.name: - ReportAvailableMediaTypes
items.desc: Tells the system what types of networking media your driver supports.

items.name: - SelectMediaType
items.desc: Selects the media type to use when communicating with the network stack.

items.name: - SetTxPacketHeadroom
items.desc: Reserves the specified number of bytes at the front of each packet.

items.name: - SetTxPacketTailroom
items.desc: Reserves the specified number of bytes at the end of each packet.

items.name: - SetMulticastAddresses
items.desc: Sets the device addresses to use for multicast filtering.

items.name: - SetAllMulticastModeEnable
items.desc: Enables or disables multicast support for your service.

items.name: - SetPromiscuousModeEnable
items.desc: Enables or disables support for monitoriong all network packets.

items.name: - SetWakeOnMagicPacketSupport
items.desc: Tells the system whether the device supports being woken up when a specially formatted packet arrives.

items.name: - SetWakeOnMagicPacketEnable
items.desc: Enables or disables support for waking up the device when a specially formatted packet arrives.

items.name: - ReportLinkStatus
items.desc: Reports the status of the link between the device and your driver to the system.

items.name: - ReportLinkQuality
items.desc: Reports the quality of the link between the device and your driver to the system.

items.name: - ReportDataBandwidths
items.desc: Reports the input and output bandwidth between the device and your driver to the system.
